collection_holder_name: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, Dorothy and Lewis B. Cullman Center
pageContext.collection_title: Music for the connoisseur [sound recording] : How to listen to modern music.
pageContext.collection_description: In this recording, "David Randolph directs his remarks in this broadcast to classical music lovers who do not like modern music ... He attempts, with examples, and a little psychology, to get the die-hard classical listener to be a little more open minded about modern music"
